comments.body:
This looks like it could be noarch?
```suggestion
  noarch: python
```
Oops I forgot to delete this comment, it can't be `noarch` due to the Windows selector.

This project does not support anything less than `python 3.6`, (we use language features which aren't back ported to `2.7` or `3.4` / `3.5`).

Correct me if I'm wrong, but it's my understanding that `noarch` refers to a package which can be run on any system, and any python version? Since we don't support some python versions, It can't be `noarch`?

`noarch` means the same "build" can be used with multiple platforms and python versions. You can introduce a constraint on the Python version without by putting `python >=3.6` and conda won't try to install it.

In general pure Python packages can be noarch but anything with compiled code can't as different binary formats are used on different platforms and the Python ABI changes between versions.

That said, a limitation of the current conda package format is that `noarch` packages have to always have the same dependencies so the `blosc-hdf5-plugin  # [not win]` line means this can't be made `noarch`.

comments.body:
I guess this is just because `blosc-hdf5-plugin` isn't built for Windows? Would it be practical to make a pull request [here](https://github.com/conda-forge/blosc-hdf5-plugin-feedstock) so this can be `noarch: python`?

It's fine if you don't want to for whatever reason.

So the `blosc-hdf5-plugin` library isn't a hard dependency for this project. It's just an optional package which mildly increases IO performance of compressed data.

It's actually a pretty huge achievement to make the `hdf5 blosc` filter available for Unix-like platforms alone. The `hdf5` plugin build/distribution/install system is fairly convoluted, and I'm not actively versed in its workings right now. It would take more time than I have right now to hack a window build script together. It might move up on my priority list in the future, but right now It's not feasible.

Since it's a totally optional package, i'm not worried about it being a major issue for distributing `Hangar` via `conda-forge`. 

Hopefully this is ok?
Yeah that's fine, once @lantiga confirms I'll merge 👍
